content: 2 these hedgehog babies are only about 3 long but they have realistic details like ears and even tiny little legs on their spine-free bellies they look cute in both realistic or fantasy colors and they work up very quickly - they would be great for stocking fillers party favors or last minute gifts size about 7 5cm 3 long if made with dk or worsted yarn for the body yarn the pattern was designed for a dk or worsted weight plain yarn plus an eyelash yarn but you could use other weights for your plain yarn as long as you adjust hook size and eye size approximate yarn requirement if using dk weight plain yarn ● plain yarn 12m / 13yd sample schachenmayr bravo 8197 wood heather ● eyelash yarn 10m / 11yd sample ice yarns eyelash white black ● 30cm / 12 of plain yarn in black or contrast color of your choice for the nose please note that even plain yarns thickness varies within the same weight category and eyelash yarns are far more unpredictable so these amounts are only a very rough guide hook size and gauge for the body of the hedgehog you want a tight gauge so the stuffing won t show between your stitches use whatever hook size allows you to achieve that - it will be smaller than suggested on the yarn label i like to use 3mm approx us size c with dk weight yarn and 3 5mm us size e with worsted weight for the eyelash yarn use a bigger hook - i suggest 5mm us size h other tools and materials ● black plastic eyes because the head is so small it is easier to use sew-on or glue-on eyes than safety eyes size 5mm for dk yarn 6mm for worsted ● black sewing thread and needle or glue to attach the eyes ● fiberfill stuffing ● sewing or embroidery thread in the color of the eyelash yarn and a matching needle ● stitch markers pair of scissors yarn needle ● optionally if using safety eyes wire cutters to shorten the eye stems a free pattern by kati gálusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation 3 abbreviations us uk/aus blo back loop only chain chain or chains double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet single_crochet increase double_crochet increase increase work 2 single_crochet in the same st work 2 double_crochet in the same st invdec invisible decrease round round single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st stitch or stitches notes the pattern is written with us terminology see the table above for the uk/australian equivalents the hedgehog is worked in rounds without turning or joining for the head and body use a stitch marker to keep track of your work attach it to the first stitch of the round replacing it when you
